Search farm location Advisory Location Advisory location
It occurs in cool, moist weather usually in early spring
Spore production is favoured by temperatures cooler than 18˚C, periods of fog and by relative humidities approaching 100%
This disease spores remain in the affected plant debris and in the soil
Fungal spores can be carried by insects, wind, rain or garden tools
Select well drained and aerated site for cultivation.
Maintain proper distance between plants for aeration and minimise leaf moisture.
Irrigate crop early in the to reduce leaf moisture. use cleaned and sanitised agri tools and machinery.
Weeds should be controlled
Deep ploughing
Crop rotation with pulses
Prune or stake plants and remove any weeds to improve air circulation

Are you facing same issue ? Ask Your Query Symptoms & Life Cycle Large numbers of spores are formed in the spots; the spores are splashed by rain onto other leaves, flowers and shoots. They germinate, infect and produce more spots and blights. Young leaves are most susceptible to infection (Photo 1). At first, the spots are small, black and irregular, often expanding to form large dead areas that dry and fall out.
On mature fruits, the fungus remains as pinpoint infections until the fruit ripens; then the infections form dark brown to black spots with orange-pink spore masses (Photo 2).

FarmSanta is a unique end to end Agritech platform developed by Singapore based Organization specialized in agriculture value chain with the philosophy to enable and empower farmers through technology, information, advisory and data science.
